questions.explanation: When stopped at an intersection, you should first look to your left, as vehicles coming from the left are closer to you than vehicles coming from the right. Look to your right, then look to your left again, in case there are any vehicles coming from that direction that you did not see at first glance.

questions.question: Which of these is a safe driving technique?
questions.answerA: Using your high beam lights in the fog.
questions.answerB: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
questions.answerC: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
questions.explanation: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

questions.question: You may not park within ____ of a crosswalk.
questions.answerB: 30 feet
questions.answerC: 40 feet
questions.explanation: Drivers may not park within 20 feet of a crosswalk at an intersection. Only park where you will not be disruptive to traffic and where other drivers can clearly see your vehicle from every direction.

questions.question: If two vehicles arrive to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time:
questions.answerA: The largest vehicle has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The car on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: The car on the left shall yield to the car on the right.
questions.answerD: The car on the right shall yield to the car on the left.
questions.explanation: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an uncontrolled intersection, the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right. The driver on the left may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
questions.answerA: As long as you turn on your four-way (emergency) flashers.
questions.answerB: If no part of your vehicle is on the road.
questions.answerC: If you need to look at a map for directions.
questions.answerD: Only if you have an emergency.
questions.explanation: It is prohibited to park on the shoulder of a freeway, except in an emergency.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid yellow arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular yellow traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Tells drivers that a green arrow is about to be shown.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow has the same meaning as a yellow traffic light. When approaching a solid yellow arrow, you must reduce your speed and prepare for a red light.

questions.question: While driving on a roadway with a single broken white centerline:
questions.answerA: You must stay within your lane.
questions.answerB: You may cross the centerline to change lanes.
questions.answerC: You may change lanes only from the left lane.
questions.explanation: White lines between lanes indicate that the lanes are traveling in the same direction. Broken white line markings indicate that it is legal to pass another vehicle when safe.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing, you should:
questions.answerB: Look for a train.
questions.answerC: Be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: When you see any signs indicating a nearby railroad crossing, you should slow down, look for a train, and be ready to stop. If the red warning lights are flashing or the gate is down, you must stop 15 to 50 feet before the railroad tracks. Do not try to go around the gate.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: There is a 35 mph speed zone after the curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Drive no slower than 35 mph around the upcoming curve.
questions.answerC: Approach the upcoming curve at a speed of 35 mph or slower.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. These signs may be accompanied by speed advisory plaques that indicate the speed with which you should proceed.

questions.question: What happens if you drink alcohol while taking prescription or over-the-counter medicine?
questions.answerA: The medicine reduces the effect of the alcohol.
questions.answerB: The alcohol will help the medicine cure a cold.
questions.answerC: The combination could multiply the effects of the alcohol or medicine.
questions.answerD: There is no effect because they are different substances.
questions.explanation: Consuming alcohol and other drugs together can increase the impairing effects of both. For example, having one drink while you are also using a cold remedy could affect you as much as several drinks would when being consumed separately from any medications.

questions.question: Drivers are required to use their turn signals when leaving a parking space.
questions.answerB: False
questions.explanation: The law states that a driver has to make a signal by hand or by using directional lights when driving out of a parking space. Communicate with other drivers to avoid crashes.

questions.question: You may pass a vehicle when:
questions.answerA: You are on a hill or curve.
questions.answerB: You are on a road with a solid line next to your lane.
questions.answerC: You are on a road with a broken line next to your lane.
questions.explanation: A single broken line indicates that drivers may cross from either lane to change lanes. Dashed yellow lines alongside solid yellow lines indicate that passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line, but not from the lane next to the solid line. Only change lanes when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If one of your tires blows out as you are driving, you should:
questions.answerB: Try to steer straight while gradually slowing by removing your foot from the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Maintain your current speed and steer straight.
questions.answerD: Swerve back and forth to alert traffic behind you.
questions.explanation: If a tire blows out while you are driving, hold the steering wheel tightly and keep the car headed straight down the road. Ease your foot off the gas pedal and do not apply the brakes until you have complete control. When the car is under control, brake gently and pull off the road at the nearest safe location.

questions.question: Having a driver license is a:
questions.answerB: Privilege, not a right.
questions.answerC: Requirement.
questions.explanation: Holding a driver license is not a right. It is a privilege that must be earned and maintained.

questions.question: When approaching a four-way stop, drivers must yield the right-of-way to all motorists who arrived before them.
questions.answerB: FALSE
questions.explanation: At a four-way stop, you must yield the right-of-way to drivers who arrived before you. Wait your turn to enter the intersection.

questions.question: Distracted driving may be caused by:
questions.answerB: Talking or texting on a cellular phone.
questions.answerC: Changing a radio station or CD.
questions.explanation: It is estimated that drivers make 200 decisions for every mile traveled, making it vital that drivers focus their full attention on the task of driving. Performing any additional task can create a dangerous distraction.

questions.question: Road rage and aggressive driving may be reduced by:
questions.answerB: Obeying posted speed limits.
questions.answerC: Using proper turn signals.
questions.explanation: As an increasing number of drivers populate the roadways, road rage becomes more prevalent. To help prevent road rage, a driver should use proper turn signals, obey posted speed limits, and allow plenty of travel time.
